errors.error_description: The primary installation command `pip install plotnine` is missing, leaving only the commands for installing optional extras, which is confusing for a standard installation.
correction_candidates: Add the line "$ pip install plotnine --default" at the beginning of the pip installation list.
Change "$ pip install 'plotnine[extra]'" to "$ pip install plotnine".
Add the line "$ pip install plotnine             # 1. should be sufficient for most" at the beginning of the pip installation list.
Add a note explaining that 'plotnine[extra]' is the new standard installation method.
errors.golden_answer: Add the line "$ pip install plotnine             # 1. should be sufficient for most" at the beginning of the pip installation list.

errors.error_description: The command to install the development version from GitHub is syntactically incorrect. It's missing the `git+https://` prefix required by pip for installing from a git repository.
correction_candidates: Change the command to "$ git clone https://github.com/has2k1/plotnine.git && cd plotnine && pip install -e .".
Change the command to "$ pip install git+https://github.com/has2k1/plotnine.git".
Change the command to "$ pip install --git https://github.com/has2k1/plotnine.git".
Change the command to "$ pip install from-git https://github.com/has2k1/plotnine.git".
errors.golden_answer: Change the command to "$ pip install git+https://github.com/has2k1/plotnine.git".

errors.error_description: The file path for the first example image is incorrect (`./docs/images/...` instead of `./doc/images/...`), which will result in a broken image link.
correction_candidates: Change the image source path from "./docs/images/readme-image-1.png" to "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/has2k1/plotnine/main/doc/images/readme-image-1.png".
Change the image source path from "./docs/images/readme-image-1.png" to "./doc/images/readme-image-1.png".
Create a symbolic link from 'docs' to 'doc' in the repository root.
Remove the "./" from the beginning of the path.
errors.golden_answer: Change the image source path from "./docs/images/readme-image-1.png" to "./doc/images/readme-image-1.png".

errors.error_description: The instructions incorrectly suggest installing matplotlib from source as a corrective step after tests fail, rather than as a necessary prerequisite to ensure consistent test outcomes. The setup should be done before running tests.
correction_candidates: Change the text to state that matplotlib must be installed from source *before* running the tests for the first time.
Add a command "pip uninstall matplotlib" before the reinstall command.
Move the entire "Testing" section to be before the "Installation" section.
Replace the text with "If tests fail, run 'pip install matplotlib --force-reinstall' and try again".
errors.golden_answer: Change the text to state that matplotlib must be installed from source *before* running the tests for the first time.
